    "title": "VCF API",
    "x-logo": {
      "url": "/documentation/images/logo-op-1-color.svg"
    },
    "description": "The Vehicle Connectivity Framework (VCF) is a REST API that allows you a\nunified and compliant access to vehicles for rapid development of mobility solutions.\n\n# Contact\nIn case of questions or requests please send an email to [vcf-team@cariad.technology](mailto:vcf-team@cariad.technology)\n\n# Prerequisites\n\n1. Obtain a valid *client id* (See [Identity *Kit*](https://identitykit.io/index.html) documentation).\n1. Go to the [Developer Portal](https://start.vwapps.io) and add the product *Consent* to your application.\n1. Create an access token by logging in as a user to your application (identified by your clientId).\n1. A valid vehicle identification number (VIN) a.k.a \"Fahrgestellnummer\" has to be known.\n\n## Consent\n\nIt is necessary to comply with the laws like EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and to explicitly get the user consent to access and store vehicle data.\nTo specify which data your App requires to access, extend the scope parameter of the IdentityKit authentication request with the required scopes.\nFor details See [Identity *Kit* Consent API](https://emea.identitykit.io/consentapi.html).\n\n> **Note:** When you obtain an access token keep in mind that you *always* need to pass additional scopes. See a list of available scopes here: `https://consent.vwgroup.io/consent/v2/scopes`\n\n**Example value app login process to access warning lights:**\n\n```BASH\ncurl -v \"https://identity-sandbox.vwgroup.io/oidc/v1/authorize?\\\nclient_id=<client_id>\\\n&scope=openid%20profile%20warning_lights\\\n&response_type=code%20id_token%20token\\\n&redirect_uri=http://localhost:8080/oauth/callback\\\n&state=<state>\"\n```\n\n**Example value app login process to get vehicle information and execute operations:**\n\n```BASH\ncurl -v \"https://identity-sandbox.vwgroup.io/oidc/v1/authorize?\\\nclient_id=<client_id>\\\n&scope=openid%20vin%20doors_windows%20parking_position%20lock_unlock\\\n&response_type=code%20id_token%20token\\\n&redirect_uri=http://localhost:8080/oauth/callback\\\n&state=<state>\"\n```\n\nIdentity*Kit* will then forward the user to a page where the consent has to be confirmed.\n\n| Endpoint                             |        Consent Scope         |\n|--------------------------------------|------------------------------|\n| Access Status                        | doors_windows                |\n| Charging Request Status              | manageCharging               |\n| Charging Care Mode                   | charging                     |\n| Set Charging Care Mode               | manageCharging               |\n| Charging Status                      | charging                     |\n| Climatisation Request Status         | manageClimatisation          |\n| Climatisation Status                 | climatisation                |\n| Get Departure Timers                 | climatisation, charging      |\n| Delete Destination                   | navigation                   |\n| Get Charging Settings                | charging                     |\n| Get Climatisation Settings           | climatisation                |\n| Get Climatisation Timers             | climatisation                |\n| Get Destinations                     | navigation                   |\n| Get Fuel Status                      | fuelLevels                   |\n| Get Maintenance Status               | serviceInterval              |\n| Get Measurements                     | (see endpoint description)   |\n| Get News Feeds                       | rssFeeds                     |\n| Get Plug and Charge Contract Status  | plugAndCharge                |\n| Get Plug and Charge Request Status   | plugAndCharge                |\n| Get Vehicle Lights                   | vehicleLights                |\n| Install Plug and Charge Contract     | plugAndCharge                |\n| Latest Warning Lights Report         | warning_lights               |\n| List of Warning Light Reports        | warning_lights               |\n| Mobile Keys                          | digitalKey                   |\n| Mobile Device Keys                   | digitalKey                   |\n| Parking Position                     | parking_position             |\n| Remote Lock / Unlock                 | lock_unlock                  |\n| Save Destination                     | navigation                   |\n| Set Charging Settings                | manageCharging               |\n| Set Climatisation Settings           | manageClimatisation          |\n| Start / Stop Charging                | manageCharging               |\n| Start / Stop Climatisation           | manageClimatisation          |\n| Transaction History                  | messageCenter                |\n| Trigger Warning Lights Update        | warning_lights               |\n| Trip Statistics                      | tripStatistics               |\n| User Capabilities                    | vin                          |\n| Vehicle Capabilities                 | vin                          |\n| Vehicle States                       | (see endpoint description)   |\n| Vehicle Status                       | (see endpoint description)   |\n| VINs For User                        | vin                          |\n| Warning Light Report By ID           | warning_lights               |\n| Warning Lights Settings              | warning_lights               |\n| Battery Support                      | vehicleOnlineCapabilities    |\n| Honk And Flash                       | honk                         |\n\n\n## API Versioning\n\nThe API versioning is done via media type versioning (e.g. application/json;version=1). It is recommended to always explicitly specify the version. By not specifying the version the endpoint always returns version 1.\n\n# Rate Limiting\n\nThere is a rate limit implemented. A maximum of 150 requests/min per userId is allowed. If exceeded we will return a 429 error.\n"
  },

      "description": "In addition to the HTTP Status code, the API can return the following\nerror codes\n\n|Code|Description|\n|----|-----------|\n| 20401 | The parking position for the provided VIN is not available |\n| 2101 | The provided user is not enrolled |\n| 2103 | The provided user does not linked to a vehicle backend |\n| 2104 | The user has no relation with the VIN |\n| 2105 | The provided request is incorrect |\n| 3102 | The Identitykit userID is missing |\n| 3103 | The specified VIN is invalid |\n| 3104 | One of the requested capabilities already have the requested state |\n| 3109 | The provided news feed url has already been subscribed to |\n| 4001 | Internal error |\n| 4002 | Underlying system unavailable |\n| 4003 | Unauthorized call |\n| 4004 | The performed call cannot be executed due to missing user consent |\n| 4005 | You are not allowed to access this resource |\n| 4006 | The requested feature is unavailable |\n| 4007 | Request is blocked due to inactive connectivity license |\n| 4101 | Invalid payload |\n| 4102 | The underlying system couldn't handle the request |\n| 4103 | Resource could not be found |\n| 4104 | The vehicle does not support the requested operation |\n| 4105 | The underlying system is not responding properly |\n| 4106 | The underlying system cannot currently handle this action |\n| 4107 | The underlying system has reached the maximum amount of destinations |\n| 4108 | The underlying system was not able to find a job for the given ID |\n| 4111 | The requested operation is not valid for the vehicle |\n| 4112 | The capability for the requested operation is missing |\n| 4113 | The capability for the requested operation has been disabled by the user |\n| 4114 | The vehicle requires exactly two climatisation timers |\n| 4115 | The underlying system has found more than one brand corresponding to the car |\n| 4116 | Disabling this capability is not allowed by backend |\n| 4117 | The capability is disabled in the vehicle |\n| 4118 | Request rejected because vehicle position is unknown |\n| 4119 | The provided position is not close enough to the vehicle position |\n| 4120 | Reached max. number of departure profiles |\n| 4121 | The vehicle is in garage mode |\n| 4122 | The operation cannot be performed because the vehicle is offline |\n| 4123 | The operation cannot be performed because of full privacy |\n| 4291 | Too many requests |\n| 4292 | The request was rejected |\n| 4293 | Previous request is still running |\n| 4294 | MSG quota limit reached |\n| 4295 | The maximum amount of requests has been reached (play protection) |\n| 4296 | The operation cannot be performed due to the insufficient battery level |\n| 4297 | The operation cannot be performed because the vehicle is in deep sleep |\n| 9999 | Undefined error |\n"

problem with the central locking system||\n|fail_charge_infrastructure|Charging is aborted because of charge infrastructure problem||\n|fail_charge_plug_not_connected|The climatisation failed because charge was not connected|Please connect the charge plug|\n|fail_charge_plug_not_connected|||\n|fail_charging_priority|The climatisation failed because charging has higher priority|Please wait until charging is complete or change the settings defining the priority|\n|fail_connection_problem|The request could not be executed due to a connection problem to the vehicle||\n|fail_conservation_charging|Battery is currently being conserved ||\n|fail_door_open|The request could not be executed because the driver door is open||\n|fail_external_power_supply|Charging error due to problem with external power supply||\n|fail_fuel_low|The fuel level is too low for auxiliary heater||\n|fail_full_privacy_mode|The operation cannot be performed because the vehicle is in full privacy mode||\n|fail_ignition_on|The command can't be processed because the ignition of the vehicle is on|Please turn the ignition off|\n|fail_key_inside_vehicle|The request could not be executed because the vehicle key is inside the vehicle||\n|fail_misuse_protection|The misuse protection for auxiliary heating took effect||\n|fail_no_external_power|Plug is connected but no power is supplied||\n|fail_not_parked_correctly|The request could not be executed because the vehicle has not been parked correctly||\n|fail_overtemp_socket|Charging is aborted because the charging socket is reporting over-temperature||\n|fail_parking_break_not_engaged|parking break is not engaged when processing a job||\n|fail_plug_autolock_error|The charging plug is not auto locked to the vehicle|Please reconnect the plug|\n|fail_plug_disconnected|The charging plug is not connected to the vehicle|Please connect the plug|\n|fail_plug_error|An unspecified problem with a charging plug occurred||\n|fail_settings_rejected|The settings could not be updated||\n|fail_vehicle_is_offline|The vehicle is offline.||\n|fail|The request could not be executed|Please try again|\n|in_progress|The request is in progress||\n|mode|||\n|navigation_target_soc_reached|Navigation SOC successfully reached||\n|offline|Vehicle is offline|\n|online|Vehicle is online|\n|polling_timeout|A timeout occurred after job status has not changed for 3 minutes||\n|profilestatus|||\n|speed_exceeded|||\n|speed_exceed_ended|||\n|status|||\n|successful|The request has been executed successfully||\n|timeout|A timeout occurred in the vehicle control unit during processing a job |Please try again|\n|target_soc_not_reachable|Target SOC could not be reached reached||\n|target_soc_reached|Target SOC successfully reached||\n|theftalarm_interior|||\n|theftalarm_exterior|||\n|theftalarm_movement|||\n|theftalarm_trailer|||\n|theftalarm_unknown|||\n|timerstatus|||\n|unavailable|The underlying backend is unavailable||\n|update|The related capability has emitted an update||\n|vehicle_enters_zone|||\n|vehicle_exits_zone|||\n|warning_daily_power_budget|Vehicle is about to reach its daily power       "name": "Readiness",
      "description": "Returns the readiness of a vehicle given its VIN.\nThe IdentityKit userID is needed because of privacy checks. MOD4 only.\n\nCallback process:\n\nThe callback URL in RemoteOperationRequest will be used to send updates about the request. Following should be the attributes of this call back endpoint :\n\n1) The endpoint should whitelist VCF client id.\n\n2) The endpoint should consume a POST call, with following body :\n\n  ```json\n  {\n    \"requestID\": \"123\", // Identifier for the update battery support state request corresponding to this callback.\n    \"status\": \"successful\",\n    \"vin\": \"VW123456789012345\"\n  }\n  ```\n\n  Status codes are listed under [here](#tag/Request-Status-Codes)\n\n3) The endpoint MUST respond with a 204, for VCF to consider it as a successful callback.\n"

      "name": "Capabilities",
      "description": "**These are the endpoints for retrieving the available capabilities for a vehicle**\n\nIt covers the services that can be performed by a vehicle, independent of\nwhich user, and the services a specific user can access for a given vehicle.\nThe services listed by the below endpoints correspond to the endpoints which are described in this documentation as well.\n\n| CapabilityID | Description | Supported by VCF |\n|-----------|-------------|-------------|\n| access |You can perform the remote lock or unlock your vehicle.| true|\n| alexa |Alexa speech control integration.| false|\n| appleMusic |Provides Apple Music Data.| false|\n| audishop |User can access the Shop (IT-Landscape of Audi Commerce Platform).| false|\n| automation |Controls the timer and location based charging and pre-trip climatisation of a vehicle.| true|\n| batteryChargingCare |Customers can active the battery charging care in order to extend the lifetime of the vehicles high voltage battery.| true|\n| batteryColdWarning |User receives recommendation for pre-conditioning the high voltage battery of the vehicle based on weather prognosis and charging state.| false|\n| batterySupport |Provides the option to allow the support of low voltage battery by the high voltage battery.| true|\n| calendar |You can synchronize calendar entries from your smartphone calendar with the main unit of the vehicle.| false|\n| cdisDigitalKey |Vehicle is able to perform Digital Key via CDIS_5d.| false|\n| charging |Provides the information about the battery status, charging status, plug status and charging settings. This capability also allows you to remotely start and stop charging and change the charging settings.| true|\n| chargingProfiles |Controls location based charging settings of the vehicle.|true|\n| chargingStations |Provides information about charging stations.| false|\n| chargingTimers |Controls the charging process of the vehicle timer based.|true|\n| chatbot |Conversational interface for question answering and to control remote vehicle services.| false|\n| cityModels |Provides detailed 3D models inside the navigation map.| false|\n| climatisation |Provides the information about the climatisation settings. This capability also allows you to remotely start and stop climatisation and change the climatisation settings and getting climatisation timers.| true|\n| climatisationTimers |Controls the pre-trip climatisation of the vehicle timer based.| true|\n| cubicNetwork |User has a contract to access cubic network for this vehicle.| false|\n| cubicNetworkConsumption |See data consumption of cubic network.| false|\n| dealerAppointment |Provides the ability to make an appointment at a dealer.| false|\n| departureProfiles |Controls the charging settings of a vehicle for specific departure times.| false|\n| departureTimers |Controls the charging and pre-trip climatisation timer based.| true|\n| destinationManagement |Provides the information on your saved destinations, add new destinations or delete the old ones.| true|\n| destinations |Allows to send single destinations or tours to the vehicle.| true|\n| destinationSync |User account based favorites, recent routes and active destinations that are synchronised between frontends and MIB2+ and MIB3 IVI systems.| false|\n| digitalKey |Digital Key is used to share a vehicle remotely.| true|\n| emergencyCalling |With the Emergency Call Service you are covered in the event of a serious incident. In emergency situations, your vehicle calls for help automatically or you can press a button to do so. If your Volkswagen detects an accident, the Service connects to the Volkswagen Emergency Call Centre and passes on key information. The Emergency call Centre will deploy the emergency services if required.| false|\n| eRoutePlanner |Provides route planning for electric vehicles.| false|\n| fuelPriceInformation |Fuel price information in map view.| false|\n| fuelStatus |Provides the remaining fuel and remaining range information for your vehicle.| true|\n| geofence |You can use the Geo-Fencing service.| true|\n| googleEarth |Provides Google Earth maps in your navigation system.| false|\n| hybridRadio |Provides radio service.| false|\n| ignition | Clamp15 related status information e.g. is ignition on or off. | true|\n| clampS | clampS related status information. | true|\n| informationCall |You can perform an Information call.| false|\n| internetRadioDataB2b |Provides data for B2B vehicles for internet radio.| false|\n| localHazards |Provides current traffic hazard information.| false|\n| mapUpdate |Automatically updates the maps in your vehicle.| false|\n| mapUpdateSd |Map update via SD card in your vehicle.| false|\n| measurements |Provides a wide set of your vehicle measurements e.g Odometer.| true|\n| mediaOnDemand |Provides media on demand via web radio streaming.| false|\n| news |Provides News.| true|\n| onlineBoardBook |Provides a car manual in the infotainment system.| false|\n| onlineLogBook |Customers can automatically record private, work and business travel trips within their vehicle.| false|\n| onlineSpeech |Use vehicle functions via voice control.| false|\n| onlineSpeechPositionData |Enhanced voice control functions including sharing of position data with third parties.| false|\n| onlineTraffic |Online traffic information updates in vehicle navigation system.| false|\n| onlineTrafficPlus |Enhanced online traffic information updates in vehicle navigation system including predicted arrival times.| false|\n| onStreetParking |Guides you to possible parking lots at your parking location.| false|\n| parkingBrake |Gives the parking brake state of your vehicle.| true|\n| parkingInformation |Gives you information about the free parking spots.| false|\n| parkingPosition |Gives the parking position of your vehicle.| true|\n| personalizationOnline |Personalized settings for seats, light, climatisation, infotainment, navigation and driver assistance.| false|\n| plugAndCharge |Vehicle starts automatically charging process after connecting to a charging station based on automated authentication with charging contract (vehicle to charging station).| true|\n| poiSearch |Points of interest with online information.| false|\n| predictiveRouting |Vehicle navigation system takes anticipated future traffic situations into calculation of the route.| false|\n| predictiveWakeUp |Optimized Infotainment Performance through a predictive wake up of the infotainment when a departure is expected.| false|\n| rangeManagement |Enables route management to take specific vehicle range values into calculation for optimized navigation.| false|\n| readiness |Provides information on the readiness status of a vehicle such as the power level category or the online status.| true|\n| remoteParkAssist |Vehicle supports remote park assist.| false|\n| re-routing when required during a trip.| false|\n| satelliteMap |Provides satellite map view instead of classic navigation map view.| false|\n| songRecognition |Provides song recognition via compact disc database.| false|\n| speedAlert |Informs you when your vehicle is faster than the defined speed limit.| true|\n| spotifyDataB2b |Provides spotify data for B2B vehicles.| false|\n| state |Provides the state of vehicle doors, windows, trunk and sunroof.| true|\n| theftWarning |This capability warns you if your vehicle is stolen.| false|\n| theming |Allows you to personalize your vehicle infotainment system with different themes and styles.| false|\n| tidal |Provides Tidal Music Data.| false|\n| trafficInformation |Provides traffic information.| false|\n| trafficLights |Provides you transactionHistoryHonkFlash |Provides transaction history for honkFlash.| true|\n| transactionHistoryLockUnlock |Provides transaction history for lockUnlock.| true|\n| transactionHistorySpeedAlert |Provides transaction history for speedAlert.| true|\n| transactionHistorySpeedAlertDelete |Deletes transaction history for speedAlert.| true|\n| transactionHistoryValet |Provides transaction history for valet.| true|\n| transactionHistoryValetDelete |Deletes transaction history for valet.| true|\n| tripStatistics |Provides remote trip statistics.| true|\n| vehicleHealth |Provides the health and diagnostics information about your vehicle.| true|\n| vehicleHealthArchive |Provides historical information of the warning lights which can possibly be shown in your vehicle dashboard.| true|\n| vehicleHealthCampaings |Provides information about field campaings like recalls or service measures.| false|\n| vehicleHealthInspection |Provides the information of the warning lights which can possibly be shown in your vehicle dashboard.| true|\n| vehicleHealthSettings |Provides the information of the warning lights settings.| true|\n| vehicleHealthTrigger |Provides the ability to trigger a warning lights report.| true|\n| vehicleHealthWakeUp |Provides the ability to fetch warnings via vehicleWakeUp job.| true|\n| vehicleHealthWarnings |Provides the information of the latest warning lights which can possibly be shown in your vehicle dashboard.| true|\n| vehicleLights |Provides the status of your vehicle lights.| true|\n| vehicleWakeUp |Wake up vehicle and provide request status information.| true|\n| vehicleWakeUpTrigger |Wake up vehicle. No request status information will be provided.| true|\n| weatherInformation |Gives the latest weather information in your vehicle.| false|\n| webRadio |Provides web radio service.| false|\n| wifiHotspot |Allows you to open a wifi hotspot within the car.| false|\n\n**Notes**\n- If VCF does not support an operation, it will still be listed with the status code 1008\n- If all the preconditions for the user to use a capability are met, then\nthe list of states will be empty\n\n**Status codes:**\n\n| Code | Description  | Reason  | Action  |\n|------|--------------|---------|---------|\n| 1001 | ServiceStatusDeactivated | - | - |\n| 1003 | ServiceStatusInitiallyDisabled | - | - |\n| 1004 | ServiceStatusDisabledByUser | User has disabled the service | User has to enable the service |\n| 1005 | ServiceStatusPrivacyMode | The vehicle is in full privacy mode | Disable full privacy mode from the vehicle |\n| 1006 | ServiceStatusWorkshopMode | Vehicle is in repair workshop | None |\n| 1007 | ServiceStatusMissingOperation | Operation is not available by the vehicle | None |\n| 1008 | ServiceStatusMissingService | Service is not available for the vehicle  | None |\n| 1009 | ServiceStatusInsufficientBatteryLevel | Vehicle does not have enough battery to perform service | Charge vehicle |\n| 1010 | ServiceStatusPowerBudgetReached | Vehicle does not have enough power budget left to perform service  | Turn clamp 15 on and off |\n| 1011 | ServiceStatusDeepSleep | Vehicle has gone in deep sleep and can take up to two minutes to respond. | None |\n| 1012 | ServiceStatusVehicleNotReachable | The online connectivity unit of the vehicle is no longer reachable. | Turn the engine on and off |\n| 1013 | ServiceStatusLocationDataDisabled | The location data in the vehicle have been disabled | User needs to activate location data in vehicle |\n| 1014 | ServiceStatusVehicleDisabled | The service is disabled from the vehicle | Enable service from the vehicle |\n| 1015 | ServiceStatusProductDisabledForVehicle | The service is disabled for the entire vehicle. | User has to enable service for the vehicle |\n| 1018 | FrontendSwitchedOff | The user has disabled the service remotely via single service deactivation. | User has to activate the service remotely |\n| 2001 | ServiceStatusLicenseInactive | License for the service is not active | Contact customer care for more info |\n| 2002 | ServiceStatusLicenseExpired | License is expired | Contact customer care for more info |\n| 2003 | ServiceStatusMissingLicense | License is missing | Contact customer care for more info |\n| 3001 | ServiceStatusUserNotVerified | Primary User Identity verification is pending | Perform primary user verfication |\n| 3002 | ServiceStatusTAndCNotAccepted | Terms and Conditions have not been accepted by Primary User | Primary user should accept Terms and Conditions |\n| 3003 | ServiceStatusInsufficientRights | - | - |\n| 3004 | ServiceStatusConsentMissing | Consent for this service is missing or has been revoked | User has to give consent for the service |\n| 3005 | ServiceStatusDeactivatedByActiveVehicleUser | Active vehicle user disabled this service | User needs to log in with the correct account in the vehicle |\n| 3006 | ServiceStatusInsufficientUserRole | The currently active vehicle user does not have sufficient user rights for this capability. | A user with a different role is needed to use the service |\n| 3007 | ServiceStatusUpstreamServiceFail | Upstream Service failed to provide necessary information | - |\n"

    {
      "name": "Access",
      "description": "Performs the remote lock or unlock operation.\n\nCallback process:\n\nThe callback URL in RemoteOperationRequest will be used to send updates about the request. Following should be the attributes of this call back endpoint :\n\n1) The endpoint should whitelist VCF client id.\n\n2) The endpoint should consume a POST call, with following body :\n\n    \"requestID\": \"123\" // Identifier for the LOCK/UNLOCK request corresponding to this callback.\n\n    \"status\": \"successful\"\n\n    \"vin\": \"VW12345\"\n\nStatus codes are listed under [here](#tag/Request-Status-Codes)\n\n3) The endpoint MUST respond with a 204, for VCF to consider it as a successful callback.\n\n4) We re-process a message every 30 seconds, which also acts as a retry if call back failed. For now we retry up to two minutes after the request was submitted. If the client does not receive a call back in __\"3 minutes\"__, the client can call back on the request action status endpoint. Once the callback endpoint responds with a 204, the message gets deleted.\n"
    },
    {
      "name": "Alerts",
      "description": "Retrieve and manipulate geofence alerts. MOD1-3 only.\n"
    },
    {
      "name": "Breakdown",
      "description": "Gathers the breakdown report by VIN or MSISDN.\n\nAny version of the `GET` endpoints prepares the responses depending on the `Accept-Language` header. If this\nheader is set, VCF tries to enrich the response. Otherwise, the response doesn't include the enriched data.\n\nVCF uses the following mapping to enable backwards compatibility for breakdown report by filling in MBB TSS IDs:\n\n  |     DataID          |     FieldID         |     Description                                 |\n  |---------------------|---------------------|-------------------------------------------------|\n  |     0x020301FFFF    |     0x0203010003    |     Maintenance -   Inspection - Due in km      |\n  |     0x020301FFFF    |     0x0203010004    |     Maintenance -   Inspection - Due in days    |\n  |     0x020501FFFF    |     0x0205010001    |     USM Info - Seat   Belt Left                 |\n  |     0x020501FFFF    |     0x0205010002    |     USM Info - Seat   Belt Right                |\n  |     0x020501FFFF    |     0x0205010003    |     USM Info - Seat   Belt Row2 Left            |\n  |     0x020501FFFF    |     0x0205010004    |     USM Info - Seat   Belt Row2 Right           |\n  |     0x020501FFFF    |     0x0205010005    |     USM Info - Seat   Belt Row2 Middle          |\n  |     0x020501FFFF    |     0x0205010006    |     USM Info - Seat   Belt Row3 Left            |\n  |     0x020501FFFF    |     0x0205010007    |     USM Info - Seat   Belt Row3 Right           |\n  |     0x020501FFFF    |     0x0205010008    |     USM Info - Seat   Belt Row3 Middle          |\n  |     0x020502FFFF    |     0x0205020001    |     Crash Intensity                             |\n  |     0x020503FFFF    |     0x0205030002    |     Impact Location   Rollover                  |\n  |     0x020503FFFF    |     0x0205030005    |     Impact Location   Right                     |\n  |     0x020503FFFF    |     0x0205030006    |     Impact Location   Left                      |\n  |     0x020503FFFF    |     0x0205030009    |     Impact Location   Front                     |\n  |     0x020503FFFF    |     0x0205030010    |     Impact   Location Rear                      |\n  |     0x030103FFFF    |     0x030103000C    |     HV SOC                                      |\n  |     0x030103FFFF    |     0x0301030005    |     Cruising   Range Primary Engine             |\n"
    },
    {
      "name": "Climatisation",
      "description": "Performs the remote start/stop climatisation operation.\n\nCallback process:\n\nThe callback URL in RemoteOperationRequest will be used to send updates about the request. Following should be the attributes of this call back endpoint :\n\n1) The endpoint should whitelist VCF client id.\n\n2) The endpoint should consume a POST call, with following body :\n\n  ```json\n  {\n    \"requestID\": \"123\", // Identifier for the start climatisation START/STOP request corresponding to this callback.\n    \"status\": \"successful\",\n    \"vin\": \"VW12345\"\n  }\n  ```\n\n  Status codes are listed under [here](#tag/Request-Status-Codes)\n\n3) The endpoint MUST respond with a 204, for VCF to consider it as a successful callback.\n\n4) We re-process a message every 30 seconds, which also acts as a retry if call back failed. For now we retry up to two minutes after the request was submitted. If the client does not receive a call back in __\"3 minutes\"__, the client can call back on the status endpoint TBD. Once the callback endpoint responds with a 204, the message gets deleted.\n"
    },
    {
      "name": "Charging",
      "description": "Performs the remote start/stop charging operation.\n\nCallback process:\n\nThe callback URL in RemoteOperationRequest will be used to send updates about the request. Following should be the attributes of this call back endpoint :\n\n1) The endpoint should whitelist VCF client id.\n\n2) The endpoint should consume a POST call, with following body :\n\n  ```json\n  {\n    \"requestID\": \"123\", // Identifier for the start climatisation START/STOP request corresponding to this callback.\n    \"status\": \"successful\",\n    \"vin\": \"VW12345\"\n  }\n  ```\n\n  Status codes are listed under [here](#tag/Request-Status-Codes)\n\n3) The endpoint MUST respond with a 204, for VCF to consider it as a successful callback.\n\n4) We re-process a message every 30 seconds, which also acts as a retry if call back failed. For now we retry up to two minutes after the request was submitted. If the client does not receive a call back in __\"3 minutes\"__, the client can call back on the status endpoint TBD. Once the callback endpoint responds with a 204, the message gets deleted.\n"

    "securitySchemes": {
      "IdentityKitToken": {
        "description": "IdentityKit access token in JWT format used for B2C usecases. Please provide the valid access\ntoken like `Bearer yourToken`. For more information please see\n[IDK documentation](https://identitykit.io/).\n\nThe IdentityKit access token needs to be provided as the `Authorization` token.\nIt contains the identity of the user (`userId`) logged in to the client application (`clientId`).\nIn addition the token provides the scopes which the user consented. The required scopes may vary for the endpoints listed below.\n\n> Note: To be able to use your token to access the endpoints your\n`clientId` must be whitelisted in VCF (see [Contact](#section/Contact)).\n",
        "type": "http",
        "scheme": "bearer",
        "bearerFormat": "JWT"
      },
      "CommercialIdentityKitToken": {
        "description": "CommercialIdentityKit (One Business ID) access token in JWT format used for B2B usecases. Please provide the valid access\ntoken like `Bearer yourToken`. For more information please see\n[CIDK documentation](https://devstack.vwgroup.com/confluence/x/FmjmEg).\n\nThe CommercialIdentityKit access token needs to be provided as the `Authorization` token.\nIt contains the identity of the client application (`clientId`). It is not required to provide the user-id in the header.\n\n> Note: To be able to use your token to access the endpoints your\n`clientId` must be whitelisted in VCF (see [Contact](#section/Contact)).\n",
        "type": "http",
        "scheme": "bearer",
        "bearerFormat": "JWT"
      }
    }

      "get": {
        "summary": "Access status",
        "description": "Returns the access status of a vehicle for a given user/VIN combination. It requires the consented scope `doors_windows` and it also requires the capability `state` to be available and enabled.\n",
        "operationId": "getVehicleStatus",
        "tags": [
          "Access"
        ],

                              "enum": [
                                "safe",
                                "unsafe",
                                "invalid"
                              ],
                              "description": "* `safe` when all doors are closed and locked and windows are closed.\n* `invalid` when the status of any door or window cannot be determined.\n* `unsafe` in case any door is unlocked or opened or any window is opened\n"
                            },
                            "carCapturedTimestamp": {
                              "description": "Timestamp when the data was read last and sent by the car. Timestamp will be formatted as RFC3339.\n",

                              "example": "2019-08-28T10:51:54Z"
                            },

                              "type": "array",

                                      "bonnet"
                                    ],

          {
            "in": "header",
            "name": "User-ID",
            "description": "IdentityKit userID. Not required if using CommercialIdentityKit token.",
            "schema": {
              "type": "string",
              "format": "uuid"
            },
            "required": true
          }
        ],
        "requestBody": {
          "content": {
            "application/json;version=1": {
              "schema": {
                "required": [
                  "callback"
                ],
                "properties": {
                  "callback": {
                    "type": "string",
                    "description": "a callback URL for VCF to provide the status of the async request. Needs to be a valid URL."
                  }
                },
                "example": {
                  "callback": "https://example.com/mycallback"
                }
              }
            }
          }
        },
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "Lock Operation Request",
            "headers": {

        "parameters": [
          {
            "name": "vin",
            "in": "path",
            "description": "A valid VIN",
            "required": true,
            "schema": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          },
          {
            "in": "header",
            "name": "User-ID",
            "description": "IdentityKit userID. Not required if using CommercialIdentityKit token.",
            "schema": {
              "type": "string",
              "format": "uuid"
            },
            "required": true
          }
        ],
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "Geofence Alerts\n",
            "headers": {
              "VCF-Trace-ID": {
                "schema": {
                  "type": "string"
                },
                "description": "Identifier for the transaction triggered by the request"
              }
            },
            "content": {
              "application/json;version=1": {
                "schema": {
                  "type": "object",
                  "properties": {
                    "data": {
                      "type": "object",
                      "properties": {
                        "carCapturedTimestamp": {
                          "description": "Timestamp when the data was read last and sent by the car. Timestamp will be formatted as RFC3339.\n",
                          "type": "string",
                          "example": "2019-08-28T10:51:54Z"
                        },
                        "maxDefinitions": {
                          "description": "Maximum amount of the configurable geofence alerts.\n",
                          "type": "number",
                          "example": 9
                        },
                        "maxActiveDefinitions": {
                          "description": "Maximum amount of the active geofence alerts.\n",
                          "type": "number",
                          "example": 4
                        },
                        "geofences": {
                          "type": "array",
                          "items": {
                            "type": "object",
                            "properties": {
                              "enabled": {
                                "type": "boolean",
                                "description": "Whether the alert activated or not",
                                "example": true
                              },
                              "id": {
                                "type": "number",
                                "description": "Identifier of the alert configuration",
                                "example": 1
                              },
                              "alertName": {
                                "type": "string",
                                "description": "Name of the alert. Can be set by user.",
                                "example": "Example alert configuration"
                              },
                              "zone": {
                                "type": "string",
                                "enum": [
                                  "exit",
                                  "enter"
                                ],
                                "description": "Describes if the alert is sent when entering or exiting a geofence",
                                "example": "exit"
                              },
                              "area": {
                                "type": "object",
                                "properties": {
                                  "type": {
                                    "type": "string",
                                    "enum": [
                                      "rectangle",
                                      "circle"
                                    ],
                                    "description": "Type of the area",
                                    "example": "rectangle"
                                  },
                                  "lat": {
                                    "type": "number",
                                    "description": "Latitude",
                                    "example": 29.272
                                  },
                                  "lon": {
                                    "type": "number",
                                    "description": "Longitude",
                                    "example": 42.144
                                  },
                                  "width": {
                                    "type": "number",
                                    "description": "Width of the geofence. Only for type `\"rectangle\"`.",
                                    "example": 4000,
                                    "nullable": true
                                  },
                                  "height": {
                                    "type": "number",
                                    "description": "Height of the geofence. Only for type `\"rectangle\"`.",
                                    "example": 2000,
                                    "nullable": true
                                  },
                                  "radius": {
                                    "type": "number",
                                    "description": "Radius of the geofence. Only for type `\"circle\"`.",
                                    "example": 2000,
                                    "nullable": true
                                  }
                                }
                              },
                              "schedule": {
                                "type": "object",
                                "nullable": true,
                                "description": "Nullable. If no schedule is defined, the speed/geofence alert is always active",
                                "properties": {
                                  "type": {
                                    "type": "string",
                                    "enum": [
                                      "recurring",
                                      "single"
                                    ],
                                    "description": "Defines whether the schedule is recurring or just for a single time period.",
                                    "example": "recurring"
                                  },
                                  "startDateTime": {
                                    "type": "string",
                                    "description": "A valid RFC 3339 timestamp such as 2019-01-01T00:00:00Z. Defaults to 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z.\nThis will only be used for single type schedules. `null` if `recurring` schedule.\n",
                                    "example": "2019-01-01T00:00:00Z",
                                    "nullable": true
                                  },
                                  "endDateTime": {
                                    "type": "string",
                                    "description": "A valid RFC 3339 timestamp such as 2019-01-01T00:00:00Z. Defaults to 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z.\nThis will only be used for single type schedules. `null` if `recurring` schedule.\n",
                                    "example": "2019-01-01T11:00:00Z",
                                    "nullable": true
                                  },
                                  "recurringOn": {
                                    "nullable": true,
                                    "type": "object",
                                    "description": "Displays on which days of the week the periodic schedule is activated.\n",
                                    "properties": {
                                      "mondays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "tuesdays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "wednesdays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "thursdays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "fridays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "saturdays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "sundays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      }
                                    }
                                  },
                                  "startTime": {
                                    "type": "string",
                                    "description": "Time of day formatted as `hh:mm` in UTC. Nullable. If both `startTime` and `endTime` is\n`null`, this means, the alert is active all day long, depending on `recurringOn` definition.\n",
                                    "example": "20:00",
                                    "nullable": true
                                  },
                                  "endTime": {
                                    "type": "string",
                                    "description": "Time of day formatted as `hh:mm` in UTC. Nullable. If both `startTime` and `endTime` is\n`null`, this means, the alert is active all day long, depending on `recurringOn` definition.\n",
                                    "example": "22:00",
                                    "nullable": true
                                  }
                                }
                              }
                            }
                          }
                        }
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }

        ],

      "put": {
        "summary": "Geofence Alert Configurations",
        "description": "Update existing geofence alert configurations. It requires the consented scope `gpsPosition` and the capability `geofence` to be available and enabled. MOD1-3 only.",
        "tags": [
          "Alerts"
        ],
        "operationId": "putAlertsGeofence",
        "parameters": [
          {
            "name": "vin",
            "in": "path",
            "description": "A valid VIN",
            "required": true,
            "schema": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          },
          {
            "in": "header",
            "name": "User-ID",
            "description": "IdentityKit userID. Not required if using CommercialIdentityKit token.",
            "schema": {
              "type": "string",
              "format": "uuid"
            },
            "required": true
          }
        ],
        "requestBody": {
          "required": true,
          "content": {
            "application/json;version=1": {
              "schema": {
                "required": [
                  "callback",
                  "geofences"
                ],
                "properties": {
                  "callback": {
                    "type": "string",
                    "description": "Callback URL for VCF to provide the status of a geofence alert action request. Needs to be a valid URL."
                  },
                  "geofences": {
                    "description": "List of geofences that should be updated.",
                    "type": "array",
                    "items": {
                      "type": "object",
                      "properties": {
                        "enabled": {
                          "type": "boolean",
                          "description": "Whether the alert activated or not",
                          "example": true
                        },
                        "id": {
                          "type": "number",
                          "description": "Identifier of the alert configuration",
                          "example": 1
                        },
                        "alertName": {
                          "type": "string",
                          "description": "Name of the alert. Can be set by user.",
                          "example": "Example alert configuration"
                        },
                        "zone": {
                          "type": "string",
                          "enum": [
                            "exit",
                            "enter"
                          ],
                          "description": "Describes if the alert is sent when entering or exiting a geofence",
                          "example": "exit"
                        },
                        "area": {
                          "type": "object",
                          "properties": {
                            "type": {
                              "type": "string",
                              "enum": [
                                "rectangle",
                                "circle"
                              ],
                              "description": "Type of the area",
                              "example": "rectangle"
                            },
                            "lat": {
                              "type": "number",
                              "description": "Latitude",
                              "example": 29.272
                            },
                            "lon": {
                              "type": "number",
                              "description": "Longitude",
                              "example": 42.144
                            },
                            "width": {
                              "type": "number",
                              "description": "Width of the geofence. Only for type `\"rectangle\"`.",
                              "example": 4000,
                              "nullable": true
                            },
                            "height": {
                              "type": "number",
                              "description": "Height of the geofence. Only for type `\"rectangle\"`.",
                              "example": 2000,
                              "nullable": true
                            },
                            "radius": {
                              "type": "number",
                              "description": "Radius of the geofence. Only for type `\"circle\"`.",
                              "example": 2000,
                              "nullable": true
                            }
                          }
                        },
                        "schedule": {
                          "type": "object",
                          "nullable": true,
                          "description": "Nullable. If no schedule is defined, the speed/geofence alert is always active",
                          "properties": {
                            "type": {
                              "type": "string",
                              "enum": [
                                "recurring",
                                "single"
                              ],
                              "description": "Defines whether the schedule is recurring or just for a single time period.",
                              "example": "recurring"
                            },
                            "startDateTime": {
                              "type": "string",
                              "description": "A valid RFC 3339 timestamp such as 2019-01-01T00:00:00Z. Defaults to 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z.\nThis will only be used for single type schedules. `null` if `recurring` schedule.\n",
                              "example": "2019-01-01T00:00:00Z",
                              "nullable": true
                            },
                            "endDateTime": {
                              "type": "string",
                              "description": "A valid RFC 3339 timestamp such as 2019-01-01T00:00:00Z. Defaults to 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z.\nThis will only be used for single type schedules. `null` if `recurring` schedule.\n",
                              "example": "2019-01-01T11:00:00Z",
                              "nullable": true
                            },
                            "recurringOn": {
                              "nullable": true,
                              "type": "object",
                              "description": "Displays on which days of the week the periodic schedule is activated.\n",
                              "properties": {
                                "mondays": {
                                  "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                  "type": "boolean",
                                  "example": true
                                },
                                "tuesdays": {
                                  "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                  "type": "boolean",
                                  "example": true
                                },
                                "wednesdays": {
                                  "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                  "type": "boolean",
                                  "example": true
                                },
                                "thursdays": {
                                  "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                  "type": "boolean",
                                  "example": true
                                },
                                "fridays": {
                                  "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                  "type": "boolean",
                                  "example": true
                                },
                                "saturdays": {
                                  "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                  "type": "boolean",
                                  "example": true
                                },
                                "sundays": {
                                  "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                  "type": "boolean",
                                  "example": true
                                }
                              }
                            },
                            "startTime": {
                              "type": "string",
                              "description": "Time of day formatted as `hh:mm` in UTC. Nullable. If both `startTime` and `endTime` is\n`null`, this means, the alert is active all day long, depending on `recurringOn` definition.\n",
                              "example": "20:00",
                              "nullable": true
                            },
                            "endTime": {
                              "type": "string",
                              "description": "Time of day formatted as `hh:mm` in UTC. Nullable. If both `startTime` and `endTime` is\n`null`, this means, the alert is active all day long, depending on `recurringOn` definition.\n",
                              "example": "22:00",
                              "nullable": true
                            }
                          }
                        }
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        },

            "schema": {
              "type": "string",
              "format": "uuid"
            },
            "required": true
          }
        ],
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "Speed Alerts\n",
            "headers": {
              "VCF-Trace-ID": {
                "schema": {
                  "type": "string"
                },
                "description": "Identifier for the transaction triggered by the request"
              }
            },
            "content": {
              "application/json;version=1": {
                "schema": {
                  "type": "object",
                  "properties": {
                    "data": {
                      "type": "object",
                      "properties": {
                        "carCapturedTimestamp": {
                          "description": "Timestamp when the data was read last and sent by the car. Timestamp will be formatted as RFC3339.\n",
                          "type": "string",
                          "example": "2019-08-28T10:51:54Z"
                        },
                        "maxDefinitions": {
                          "description": "Maximum amount of the configurable geofence alerts.\n",
                          "type": "number",
                          "example": 9
                        },
                        "maxActiveDefinitions": {
                          "description": "Maximum amount of the active geofence alerts.\n",
                          "type": "number",
                          "example": 4
                        },
                        "speedAlerts": {
                          "type": "array",
                          "items": {
                            "type": "object",
                            "properties": {
                              "enabled": {
                                "type": "boolean",
                                "description": "Whether the alert activated or not",
                                "example": true
                              },
                              "id": {
                                "type": "number",
                                "description": "Identifier of the alert configuration",
                                "example": 1
                              },
                              "alertName": {
                                "type": "string",
                                "description": "Name of the alert. Can be set by user.",
                                "example": "Example alert configuration"
                              },
                              "allowedSpeedLimit_kmph": {
                                "type": "number",
                                "description": "Allowed kmph speed limit",
                                "example": 80
                              },
                              "schedule": {
                                "type": "object",
                                "nullable": true,
                                "description": "Nullable. If no schedule is defined, the speed/geofence alert is always active",
                                "properties": {
                                  "type": {
                                    "type": "string",
                                    "enum": [
                                      "recurring",
                                      "single"
                                    ],
                                    "description": "Defines whether the schedule is recurring or just for a single time period.",
                                    "example": "recurring"
                                  },
                                  "startDateTime": {
                                    "type": "string",
                                    "description": "A valid RFC 3339 timestamp such as 2019-01-01T00:00:00Z. Defaults to 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z.\nThis will only be used for single type schedules. `null` if `recurring` schedule.\n",
                                    "example": "2019-01-01T00:00:00Z",
                                    "nullable": true
                                  },
                                  "endDateTime": {
                                    "type": "string",
                                    "description": "A valid RFC 3339 timestamp such as 2019-01-01T00:00:00Z. Defaults to 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z.\nThis will only be used for single type schedules. `null` if `recurring` schedule.\n",
                                    "example": "2019-01-01T11:00:00Z",
                                    "nullable": true
                                  },
                                  "recurringOn": {
                                    "nullable": true,
                                    "type": "object",
                                    "description": "Displays on which days of the week the periodic schedule is activated.\n",
                                    "properties": {
                                      "mondays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "tuesdays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "wednesdays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "thursdays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "fridays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "saturdays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      },
                                      "sundays": {
                                        "description": "Defaults to false.",
                                        "type": "boolean",
                                        "example": true
                                      }
                                    }
                                  },
                                  "startTime": {
                                    "type": "string",
                                    "description": "Time of day formatted as `hh:mm` in UTC. Nullable. If both `startTime` and `endTime` is\n`null`, this means, the alert is active all day long, depending on `recurringOn` definition.\n",
                                    "example": "20:00",
                                    "nullable": true
                                  },
                                  "endTime": {
                                    "type": "string",
                                    "description": "Time of day formatted as `hh:mm` in UTC. Nullable. If both `startTime` and `endTime` is\n`null`, this means, the alert is active all day long, depending on `recurringOn` definition.\n",
                                    "example": "22:00",
                                    "nullable": true
                                  }
                                }
                              }
                            }
                          }
                        }
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "400": {
            "description": "Bad request",
            "headers": {
              "VCF-Trace-ID": {
                "schema": {
                  "type": "string"

      "post": {
        "summary": "Speed Alert Configuration",
        "description": "Create a new speed alert configuration. It requires the consented scope `vehicleSpeed` and the capability `speedAlert` to be available and enabled. MOD1-3 only.",
        "tags": [
          "Alerts"
        ],
        "operationId": "postAlertsSpeed",
        "parameters": [
          {
            "name": "vin",
            "in": "path",
            "description": "A valid VIN",
            "required": true,
            "schema": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          },
          {
            "in": "header",
            "name": "User-ID",
            "description": "IdentityKit userID. Not required if using CommercialIdentityKit token.",
            "schema": {
              "type": "string",
              "format": "uuid"
            },
            "required": true
          }
        ],
        "requestBody": {
          "required": true,
          "content": {
            "application/json;version=1": {
              "schema": {
                "required": [
                  "callback",
                  "speedAlert"
                ],
                "properties": {
                  "callback": {
                    "type": "string",
                    "description": "Callback URL for VCF to provide the status of a speed alert action request. Needs to be a valid URL."
                  },
                  "speedAlert": {
                    "description": "The desired new speed alert.",
                    "type": "object",
                    "properties": {
                      "enabled": {
                        "type": "boolean",
                        "description": "Whether the alert activated or not",
                        "example": true
                      },
                      "alertName": {
                        "type": "string",
                        "description": "Name of the alert. Can be set by user.",
                        "example": "Example alert configuration"
                      },
                      "allowedSpeedLimit_kmph": {
                        "type": "number",
                        "description": "Allowed kmph speed limit",
                        "example": 80
                      },
                      "schedule": {
                        "type": "object",
                        "nullable": true,
                        "description": "Nullable. If no schedule is defined, the speed/geofence alert is always active",
                        "properties": {
                          "type": {
                            "type": "string",
                            "enum": [
                              "recurring",
                              "single"
                            ],
                            "description": "Defines whether the schedule is recurring or just for a single time period.",
                            "example": "recurring"
                          },
                          "startDateTime": {
                            "type": "string",
                            "description": "A valid RFC 3339 timestamp such as 2019-01-01T00:00:00Z. Defaults to 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z.\nThis will only be used for single type schedules. `null` if `recurring` schedule.\n",
                            "example": "2019-01-01T00:00:00Z",
                            "nullable": true
                          },
                          "endDateTime": {
                            "type": "string",
                            "description": "A valid RFC 3339 timestamp such as 2019-01-01T00:00:00Z. Defaults to 0001-01-01T00:00:00Z.\nThis will only be used for single type schedules. `null` if `recurring` schedule.\n",
                            "example": "2019-01-01T11:00:00Z",
                            "nullable": true
                          },
                          "recurringOn": {
                            "nullable": true,

                            }

                            "type": "string",

                              "nullable": true
                            },
                            "endTime": {
                              "type": "string",
                              "description": "Time of day formatted as `hh:mm` in UTC. Nullable. If both `startTime` and `endTime` is\n`null`, this means, the alert is active all day long, depending on `recurringOn` definition.\n",
                              "example": "22:00",
                              "nullable": true
                            }
                          }
                        }
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }
        },
        "responses": {
          "202": {
            "description": "Update Speed response\n",
            "headers": {
              "VCF-Trace-ID": {
                "schema": {
                  "type": "string"
                },

        "summary": "Valet Alert Configuration",
        "description": "Create a new valet alert configuration. It requires the consented scope `gpsPosition`, `vehicleSpeed` and the capability `valetAlert` to be available and enabled. MOD1-3 only.",
        "tags": [
          "Alerts"
        ],
        "operationId": "postAlertsValet",
        "parameters": [
          {
            "name": "vin",
            "in": "path",
            "description": "A valid VIN",
            "required": true,
            "schema": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          },
          {
            "in": "header",
            "name": "User-ID",
            "description": "IdentityKit userID. Not required if using CommercialIdentityKit token.",
            "schema": {
              "type": "string",
              "format": "uuid"
            },
            "required": true
          }
        ],
        "requestBody": {
          "required": true,
          "content": {
            "application/json;version=1": {
              "schema": {
                "required": [
                  "callback",
                  "valetAlert"
                ],
                "properties": {
                  "callback": {
                    "type": "string",
                    "description": "Callback URL for VCF to provide the status of a valet alert action request. Needs to be a valid URL."
                  },
                  "valetAlert": {
                    "type": "object",
                    "properties": {
                      "allowedSpeedLimit_kmph": {
                        "type": "number",
                        "description": "Allowed kmph speed limit",
                        "example": 80
                      },
                      "position": {
                        "type": "object",
                        "description": "Position",
                        "properties": {
                          "lat": {
                            "type": "number",
                            "description": "Latitude"
                          },
                          "lon": {
                            "type": "number",
                            "description": "Longitude"
                          },
                          "gpsRadius_m": {
                            "type": "number",
                            "description": "Radius in m",
                            "nullable": true
                          }
                        }
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          }

    "/vehicles/{vin}/breakdownreport": {
      "get": {
        "description": "Returns the breakdown report for given vehicle.",
        "summary": "Breakdown Report by Vehicle",
        "tags": [
          "Breakdown"
        ],
        "operationId": "getBreakdownReport",
        "parameters": [
          {
            "name": "vin",
            "in": "path",
            "description": "A valid VIN",
            "required": true,
            "schema": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          },
          {
            "name": "Accept-Language",
            "in": "header",
            "description": "Locale string for the report. If empty, a default language will be used.",
            "required": false,
            "example": "de-DE",
            "schema": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          }
        ],
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "The breakdown report of the car",
            "headers": {
              "VCF-Trace-ID": {
                "schema": {
                  "type": "string"
                },
                "description": "Identifier for the transaction triggered by the request"
              }
            },
            "content": {
              "application/json;version=2": {
                "schema": {
                  "type": "object",
                  "properties": {

        ],

    "/msisdns/{msisdn}/breakdownreport": {
      "get": {
        "description": "Returns the breakdown report for given MSISDN.",
        "summary": "Breakdown Report by MSISDN",
        "tags": [
          "Breakdown"
        ],
        "operationId": "getMsisdnBreakdownReport",
        "parameters": [
          {
            "name": "msisdn",
            "in": "path",
            "description": "A valid MSISDN number",
            "required": true,
            "schema": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          },
          {
            "name": "Accept-Language",
            "in": "header",
            "description": "Locale string for the report. If empty, a default language will be used.",
            "required": false,
            "example": "it-IT",
            "schema": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          },
          {
            "name": "Brand",
            "in": "header",
            "description": "Brand code of the vehicle.\n\nPossible values:\n* Audi\n* VW\n* Skoda\n* Seat\n* VWN\n",
            "required": true,
            "example": "Audi",
            "schema": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          },
          {
            "name": "Country",
            "in": "header",
            "description": "Country code",
            "example": "DE",
            "required": false,
            "schema": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          }
        ],
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "The breakdown report of the car",

                                          }
                                        }
                                      }
                                    }
                                  }
                                }
                              }
                            }
                          },

                            "type": "string",
                            "example": "0x01FFFFFFFF"
                          }
                        }
                      }

                      "type": "string",
                      "example": "2019-01-09T10:02:40Z",
                      "description": "Timestamp of received breakdown report."

    "/vehicles/{vin}/capabilities": {
      "get": {
        "summary": "Vehicle Capabilities",
        "description": "Returns the list of available capabilities for a given VIN. It requires the consented scope `vin`.\n",
        "operationId": "getCapabilities",
        "tags": [
          "Capabilities"
        ],
        "parameters": [
          {
            "name": "vin",
            "in": "path",
            "required": true,
            "description": "A valid VIN",
            "schema": {
              "type": "string"
            }
          },
          {
            "name": "id",
            "in": "query",
            "required": false,
            "description": "Filter out other capabilities. When not set, will default to returning all available capabilities.",

              "type": "string",
              "example": "climatisation,charging"

          }
        ],
        "responses": {
          "200": {

              }
            },
            "content": {
              "application/json;version=1": {
                "schema": {
                  "properties": {
                    "data": {
                      "type": "array",
                      "items": {
                        "type": "object",
                        "required": [
                          "id",
                          "status"
                        ],
                        "properties": {
                          "id": {
                            "type": "string",
                            "example": "vehiclehealth_v1",
                            "description": "A unique identifier for the capability"
                          },

                            "type": "array",
                            "items": {
                              "description": "| Code | Description  |\n|------|--------------|\n| 1001 | ServiceStatusDeactivated |\n| 1003 | ServiceStatusInitiallyDisabled |\n| 1004 | ServiceStatusSwitchedOff |\n| 1005 | ServiceStatusPrivacyMode |\n| 1006 | ServiceStatusWorkshopMode |\n| 1007 | ServiceStatusMissingOperation |\n| 1008 | ServiceStatusMissingService |\n| 1009 | ServiceStatusInsufficientBatteryLevel |\n| 1010 | ServiceStatusServiceStatusPowerBudgetReached |\n| 1011 | ServiceStatusDeepSleep |\n| 1013 | ServiceStatusLocationDataDisabled |\n| 1014 | ServiceStatusVehicleDisabled |\n| 1015 | ServiceStatusProductDisabledForVehicle |\n| 2001 | ServiceStatusLicenseInactive |\n| 2002 | ServiceStatusLicenseExpired |\n| 3001 | ServiceStatusUserNotVerified |\n| 3002 | ServiceStatusTAndCNotAccepted |\n| 3003 | ServiceStatusInsufficientRights |\n| 3005 | ServiceStatusDeactivatedByActiveVehicleUser |\n| 5001 | ServiceStatusUpstreamServiceFail |\n",
